com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.annotations

Class Marker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.annotations.Annotation
      • com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.annotations.Marker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Annotation>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CityStateMarker, CountryMarker
    Deprecated. 
    As of 7.0.0, use Mapbox Annotation Plugin instead

    @Deprecated
public class Marker
extends Annotation
    Marker is an annotation that shows an icon image at a geographical location. The default marker uses a provided icon. This icon can be customized using IconFactory to generate an Icon using a provided image. Markers are added to the map by first giving a LatLng and using MapboxMap.addMarker(MarkerOptions). The marker icon will be centered at this position so it is common to add padding to the icon image before usage.

    Markers are designed to be interactive. They receive click events by default, and are often used with event listeners to bring up info windows. An InfoWindow is displayed by default when either a title or snippet is provided.
